definitions: an activity done in addition to one's main job, especially to earn extra income

examples.text: a sideline career as a stand-up comic

shortDefinitions: activity done in addition to one's main job

definitions: an auxiliary line of goods or business

examples.text: electronic handbooks are a lucrative sideline for the firm

shortDefinitions: auxiliary line of goods or trade

definitions: either of the two lines bounding the longer sides of a football field, basketball court, tennis court, or similar playing area

examples.text: Gascoigne celebrated his goal by sprinting to the sidelines

shortDefinitions: either of two lines bounding longer sides of football field, basketball court, or similar

definitions: the area immediately outside either sideline as a place for nonplayers, substitutes, or spectators

examples.text: his son watched from the sidelines

shortDefinitions: area immediately outside such lines as place for non-players

definitions: a position where one is observing a situation rather than being directly involved in it

examples.text: the US has chosen to remain on the sidelines
we are not just watching from the sidelines, we are rolling our sleeves up and getting involved

shortDefinitions: position where one is observing situation rather than directly involved in it

definitions: cause (a player) to be unable to play in a team or game

examples.text: he has been sidelined for the last six weeks with a fractured wrist

shortDefinitions: cause player to be unable to play in team or game

definitions: remove from the center of activity or attention; place in a less influential position

examples.text: a respected lawyer will be sidelined by alcohol abuse

shortDefinitions: remove from centre of activity or attention
